results.title: An Irish Castle to Call Your Own
results.abstract: To most, the striking stone towers that dot the Irish countryside are quaint ruins. To a few ambitious people, they’re the perfect places to make into homes — and one-of-a-kind vacation rentals.

media.caption: The newly renovated Drummond Tower was built by a wealthy landowner in 1858 in remembrance of his mother. Four small rooms are stacked atop each other; a timber roof deck offers panoramic farmland views.
media.copyright: Flower and Stone
